results.title: I Call It Home
results.brief_description: This program examines the homelessness in Melbourne with a specific focus on a Government redevelopment plan to provide improved sheltering services for single men. Councillors, welfare workers and the men themselves, discuss the reality of the system and what the Government plan will provide.

results.title: I am Joe's heart. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to show the effects of lack of exercise, heavy smoking, and overindulgence in fatty foods and alcohol on the heart. Shows how the heart and circulatory system function and stresses exercise and healthful living.

results.title: I am Fijian
results.brief_description: A look at the diversity of customs, traditions and religions of Fiji. Some of them have remained virtually unchanged, like the Hindu religious ritual of fire walking, or the Kava Ceremony. Others have been adapted or modified by western influences such as the Polynesian wedding, or a Fijian funeral service. Narrated by Peter Gwynne.

results.title: I am a guitar
results.brief_description: Shows how Ignacio Fleta and his sons lovingly shape and sand classical guitar frames, apply the inlaid rosette that is their trademark and polish the well-seasoned Cuban cedar, etc that constitutes the kind of instrument Andres Segovia or John Williams would wait a decade to play. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: I'm talking about my life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Angelina Luke, Garry Bietel, Joann Geschiecht, Le Videographe and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Angelina is married to a violent man with a drinking problem. But her Malaysian culture makes it hard for her to leave but when she does she she succeeds. She then becomes determined to help other women in similar situations.

results.title: I'm No Fool with Fire (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Host, Jiminy Cricket, describes the three elements needed to start a fire and warns of ways fires can start through carelessness. This safety classic goes behind-the-scenes at a real fire station where a fire fighter helps three youngsters review fire safety procedures.
results.description: Host, Jiminy Cricket, describes the three elements needed to start a fire and warns of ways fires can start through carelessness. This safety classic goes behind-the-scenes at a real fire station where a fire fighter helps three youngsters review fire safety procedures.

results.title: I'm no fool with a bicycle
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket traces the development of the bicycle from the hobby horse to the modern safety bicycle, and presents safety rules for riding a bicycle: keep both hands on the handle bars, both wheels on the ground and both feet on the pedals, and obey the same traffic rules as the driver of a car.

results.title: I'm no fool in water
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket tells something of the history of swimming as a sport and goes on to describe the safety rules for swimming. Among these are the right and wrong places to swim, the chief water hazards, the need to wait two hours after eating and to swim in company.
results.description: Jiminy Cricket tells something of the history of swimming as a sport and goes on to describe the safety rules for swimming. Among these are the right and wrong places to swim, the chief water hazards, the need to wait two hours after eating and to swim in company.

results.title: I'm no fool having fun
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket explains how the human race has always needed play, recreation and fun. He contrasts unsafe play areas such as excavations, streets, new constructions or abandoned buildings, with safe areas, such as playgrounds, parks, one’s own backyard. Safety in various recreations, hiking, swimming, cycling, skating and sailing. Warns against showing off or getting overtired - a tired person is a careless one. Only a “common ordinary fool” violates the safety rules.

results.title: I'm Google

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: “I’m Google is an ongoing tumblr blog in which batches of images and videos that I cull from the internet are compiled into a long stream-of-consciousness.” - Dina Kelberman
description_for_label: “I’m Google is an ongoing tumblr blog in which batches of images and videos that I cull from the internet are compiled into a long stream-of-consciousness.” - Dina Kelberman
